oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Steele Hall, LeMoyne College
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Hooks Brothers Photographers
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Finding Community
Schools
African American college students; African American universities and colleges; College buildings
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Two and one half story, brick building with three bay facade, stone window sills, lintels, and detailing. Two covered entry doors are located on either end of the front facade, with additional entrances at either end of the building. James Alexander Construction Co. sign out front. "Hooks foto" written in marker on the photograph.
Steele Hall, which was originally built to be the college library, appears newly completed in this photograph. It is the oldest building on the Walker Avenue campus.
